name: Hilton Garden Inn Durham Southpoint

reviews.text: Easy access off the interstate. Located across the street from the mall yet situated in an outside shopping area. Shop. Get your nails done. Dinner-in walking distance. Great reception from front desk staff. Hotel, clean and lived up to expectations.
reviews.title: A Travelers Dream

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying here for our annual Holiday Party. The dinner was in the Banquet Room and catered by the attached Ruth Chris Steakhouse. The food was fantastic, the service was impeccable. Great location across the street from the upscale Southpoint Mall. I will stay here everytime I travel to Durham.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service,Great Location,Excellent Food, Super Banquet Facility

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here for our annual girls weekend. I was not sure how many girls would make the trip so I booked only one room (a corner room with two queen beds). We ended up with a total of five girls. I called the hotel the night before and asked if we could have a roll away bed put into our room and it was there when we checked in. The room was really nice and spacious and the extra bed fit into the corner with alot of extra space around it. The bathroom was a little small (for five girls) but we made it work. The breakfast in the morning was great!!!! It was $10.95 and had alot of items to choose from including a chef who made to order eggs, omelets, pancakes, french toast etc. The hotel is across the street from a large mall with alot of common stores (maci's, nordstroms etc.) and restaurants (Maggiano's, Champs, California pizza kitchen, Coldstones etc.) I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT AND NICE

reviews.text: I recently spent a long weekend (6 to 8 march) at this hotel to help my daughter, living in this area, to prepare her move to a new appartment. I really enjoyed all the amenities and the friendly welcome from the staff of this hotel, plus the great location near a superb mall for shopping and dinning.
reviews.title: Excellent weekend at the Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.text: Great experience!
reviews.title: Perfect location, nice clean comfortable place to rest.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights while my daughter was at Duke University for summer camp. Very clean rooms, wish we could have gotten a king bed instead of queen and that the room was a little larger (kind of small for 3 people). Young African American man at front desk was very friendly and spoke to us when we returned each night - made our day as he was so friendly. It was about a 15-20 min. drive to Duke University so we probably should have stayed closer but wasn't familiar with the area. Next time we would stay in a hotel off 15-501 which has lots of places to eat, shop and is much closer to Duke. It was nice having a Super mall across the street so all turned out well.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, great desk service, nice place to stay, mall across street

reviews.text: Very nice, no surprises - everything you expect from the brand. Senior rate was $116 which I thought was a good deal. Excellent location - across the street from an upscale mall, and close to lots of upscale chain restaurants like California Pizza Kitchen, PF Chang's, Ruths Chris Steakhouse, Maggianos, etc. The continental breakfast is nicer than average, but not included in room rate; it's $6.95 for cold items, $10.95 for the omelet bar which was very good.
reviews.title: Very pleasant, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was so insubstantial in all respects, that I am shocked. We had what they considered to be a "suite." The "suite" was tiny, and the bathroom was probably one of the worst bathrooms I have ever experienced (Including a tiny bathroom at a Parisien hotel).
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was quite awful (and was not included). The decor was rather nasty.
reviews.title: Upscale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason to stay at this hotel is that one can walk to the Southpoint Mall from the hotel. Apart from that, this hotel should be missed.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for my Duke reunion!

reviews.text: Very clean linens and room. Bathroom on the small size for such a nice hotel. Right in a small shopping center and just across the street from the mall. Wish they had an outside pool as it stays warm pretty late in the year but they do have a small inside one. We are repeat customers and love it; wish they would fully attend the bar.
reviews.title: Very clean linens and room. Bathroom on...

reviews.text: This is a new property, so the rooms and facilities are in good shape. It's location seemed a bit odd to me, a mile or so off the highway in the corner of a shopping plaza. What makes this location unique is that it is attached to a Ruth's Chris Steak House. This is certainly unusual for non-premier property.
reviews.title: Met All Needs

reviews.text: My room was a bit small and one of the (two) elevators wasn't working.
reviews.title: Extremely Surprised - BUG was in Room and Front Desk Clerk was unconcerned

reviews.text: As a CPA, I travel quite frequently to visit with my various clients throughout South and North Carolinas. I typically stay at this hotel due to its cleanliness and friendly staff. Upon check in, the gentleman remembered my name and provided me with two bottles of water.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Durham

reviews.text: The negatives -- My room was above Ruth Chris restaurant. Starting at 11pm, the staff used a trash compactor for at least two hours. If you plan on sleeping before 1am, stay on the other side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very, Very NICE
Great business hotel and great location
reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip and had no rental car. The hotel is 10 miles away from the airport and easy to get to. It is in a suburb in a strip mall with a Nordstrom Rack, Best Buy, KREI, lots of other stores and restaurants (Chilis and Ruth Chris). Across the street, walking distance is a large upscale mall with a Nordstrom, Macys, Apple Store, and lots of restaurants (Maggianos). The hotel is very well organized. There is a pantry with food available 24 hrs/day. There are laundry facilities, too. Since I am a Hilton gold member, I got complimentary breakfast every morning ($11.00/day otherwise). There is cold and hot food and you can get eggs cooked any way you want and pancakes or french toast. I was there on a Saturday morning and it still was not crowded.

My room was quiet and large and clearn. I was facing the front of the hotel on the 4th floor away from the restaurants. The room had a dresser, TV, seating area, desk, free WI-FI, refridgerator, coffee maker, and a reasonable bathroom. The bed is adjustable to your comfort level.
reviews.title: Outstanding service and hotel

reviews.text: I ate at the hotel one night for dinner, Southern Fried Chicken, and it was good. I also ate at Ruth Chris's with a large group and that meal was great. There are lots of good restuarants in the area.
reviews.title: Desk Staff Lacking Knowledge and Customer Skills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend staying here!!
reviews.title: Great for what it is

reviews.text: We traveled to Durham to see my brother, his wife and their new baby. Since his mother-in-law was there we decided to stay in a hotel. The HGI was the closest to his home. We had made a reservation for a king room with a rollaway bed. When we arrived, even though the internet reservation showed that we had reserved the rollaway, they didn't have it in their system and there was a collegiate baseball tournament going on so the hotel was out of rollaway beds. The clerk at the desk without hesitation put us in a king junior suite that had a fold out sofa (perfect for our son) at no additional charge. There was no discussion, he just made the arrangement. Even though the room was right by the elevator and there were a lot of baseball players in the hotel, we didn't hear any noise except light traffic noise since our room faced Fayetteville Rd./the mall.
reviews.title: Good for a short stay

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Durham Southpoint Hotel
